result.execSummary:
The defendant Betsy M Sullivan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
Must undergo a psychological assessment and follow through with recommendations.
No consumption or possession of alcohol. No entry into any bar or tavern.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with all recommendations.

The defendant must attend at least one AA/NA or similar meeting per week.

defendant.name: Sullivan, Betsy M

records.addlTxt: Defendant Betsy M Sullivan in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Defendant Betsy M Sullivan in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:17 PM. Lynch has revocation summary and does not note any errors or inaccuracies. Parties review revocation - looks as if P&P is recommending anywhere between 9-18 months. State makes argument prior to his recommendation - recommends 1 year jail on each count - concurrent to each other - credit for whatever she is entitled to. Lynch makes argument prior to sentencing - recommends 7 months in county jail on each count - concurrent to each other  - grant huber and good time - credit for 187 days (stipulated to). Sullivan responds. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #1 and #2 - 9 months on each count - concurrent to each other -- credit for 187 days - huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3), turn any unpaid fines into civil judgment, right to appeal, adjourned.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 14, 2018 at 01:00 pm.
Per ROAW, defendant is currently in the Monroe County Jail

records.addlTxt: Defendant Betsy M Sullivan in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 11:13 AM. State - has CT 1 enhancer will be dismissed and repeater to will be amended.939.62(1)(a) and now a misd. CT 2 - enhancer to be dismissed and repeater will be amened to 939.62 (1)(a). DRI count 3. 2 years probation, costs only, conditions are open. Voorhees agrees and has provided the court with a PLQ, defendant agrees. Court DRI count 3. Court amends count 1 to delete enhancer and amends the repeter action to 939.62(1)(a). Defendant pleads G to count 1. Court amends count 2 to delete enhancer on the count and amend the repeater action 939.62(1)(a). Defendant pleads guilty to count 2. Court goes over PLQ with defendant and find the defendant is freely, voluntairly and intelligentily entering her plea and right to jury trial. Court finds factual basis and adjudges guilty. State - makes final statement and asks for conditions of no consumption or possession of alchol, AODA, ect. Voorhees makes final statement and asks for cout to follow recommendation, 48 days jail credit. Sullivan makes statement, remorseful. Court has considered all statement by all parties and proceeds to sentencing: Count 1 - With hold sentence and place on probation for 2 years with condtions of costs, no consumption or possession of alcohol, no entry into any bar or tavern, FT employment/schooling, 100 hours of community service, one AA/NA meeting per week, AODA and follow through, phycological evaluation and follow through with recommendations. Count 2 - with hold sentence and place on probation for 2 years, to run concurrent with count 1 - same conditions, no additional community service hours. 48 days jail credit if revoked, right to appeal, DNA sample required. Voorhees questions money that was seized at time of arrest.

Defendant Betsy M Sullivan in custody and appears via video from FOSO with attorney John E Voorhees appearing in court. Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:55 AM. Sullivan and Voorhees have complaint. Vorhees has not gone over the complaint with the defendant. Court reads charges and penalties. Voorhees and Sullivan understand charges and penalties and waive formal reading. State - Sullivan is on a probation hold, has waived revocation. Voorhees agrees but wants to address bond - requests signature bond for stated reasons, would request a PH in short time. State - bond - prefer some cash as bond for stated reasons. Court continues bond - sets for PH. Voorhees reserves right to address bail in the future.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 11:00 am.
